what-it-does: Checks for uses of hardcoded charsets, which are defined in Python string module.
why-is-this-bad: Usage of named charsets from the standard library is more readable and less error-prone.
example:
x = "0123456789"
y in "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"



Use instead


import string

x = string.digits
y in string.ascii_lowercase
